intro: Calycothrix simplex, commonly known as the simple calycothrix, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, unbranched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
